title: Deathfire Touch
body: So let's say Zilean only damages 1 target with his bomb, would the full duration of Deathfire Touch go off since he only damaged 1 target or still the AoE duration? Thanks

replies.body: It is an AoE spell, so no matter how many targets are actually hit, it will still only trigger the AoE duration.

Probably notable exception would be {{champion:30}}'s Q Lay Waste. Even though it's an AoE spell, it has a special rule tacked to it where it does double damage to single target if it only hits 1 target. And also applies spell effects like deathfire as single target. (Not 100% confirmed on this, but like 95.2% sure that's how it works.)

I think there may be a few others like this but can't think of them atm. Old {{champion:82}} Q used to be, but they changed that.

But for the most part, yeah, just cause an AoE spell only hit 1 target doesn't mean it's not an AoE spell, cause it still had the potential to hit multiple targets. Just think of it like a skillshot that could have hit multiple targets, but missed all targets but one.
Jhin is also a bit unique.  His W and R hit an "aoe" but only one champion.  The champion hits count as single target while minion/monster hits count as aoe.
